FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule G, Part I, Line 2b(v) Amounts paid to fundraiser
ExplntnTxt: Washburn & McGoldrick was engaged to increase private philanthropic support for IIT's operating budget, endowment and facilities. They do not at any time have custody or control of contributions. IIT exercises control and approval over the content and volume of any solicitation as Washburn & McGoldrick never conducts solicitations on IIT's behalf. Payments for services are based on a monthly retainer and a per diem rate. Expenses are billed separately as expended and at cost, for travel, overnight accommodations, meals, and out-of-pocket expenses. RuffaloCODY conducted telephone fundraising campaigns for IIT and provided services to secure pledges and donations to support the educational mission of IIT. Their services related to the concept, design and strategies of the campaign and telephone solicitations to individuals identified on lists supplied by IIT. All funds raised were controlled by IIT. RuffaloCODY was paid fees for services provided in conducting the telephone fundraising campaigns.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form 990, Schedule G, Part II, Fundraising Events
ExplntnTxt: The Women & Science program is an important outreach and fundraising initiative of The Rockefeller University. Comprised of a wide circle of friends and benefactors, Women & Science provides support for education and career advancement of scientists in biomedical research and related fields. One component of this initiative is the annual Women & Science Lecture and Luncheon.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form 990, Schedule G, Part II, Fundraising Events
ExplntnTxt: The Parents & Science program is an important outreach and fundraising initiative of The Rockefeller University. Parents & Science sponsors events that feature distinguished Rockefeller University scientists and eminent guest speakers from such fields as psychology, medicine, education, and the social sciences. A major focus is emerging discoveries and biomedical breakthroughs that are improving the health and well-being of children. Two components of this initiative are the annual Celebrating Science Benefit and Science Saturday, a community building event which enables parents to bring their children to the University.

STOCKADE CONSULTING GROUP ACTED STRICTLY IN THE ROLE OF OUR AGENT IN SECURING PLEDGES OF SUPPORT. THE PROCESSING OF ALL PLEDGE PAYMENTS AND CREDIT CARD TRANSACTIONS WERE HANDLED BY UNIVERSITY EMPLOYEES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2B, COLUMN (V)
ExplntnTxt: FINANCIAL PLANNING MINISTRY (FPM) PROVIDES A SERVICE THAT MIGHT EVENTUALLY RESULT IN A CHARITABLE BEQUEST FROM AN ESTATE. FPM CHARGES A $3,125 PER MONTH ($37,500 PER YEAR) FLAT RATE FOR JOHNSON UNIVERSITY TO BE A PARTNER ORGANIZATION. FPM CONDUCTS ESTATE PLANNING SEMINARS WHERE PARTICIPANTS ARE OFFERRED THE OPPORTUNITY TO INCLUDE A CHARITABLE BEQUEST FOR ONE OF THE PARTNER CHARITIES. THE ONLY IMMEDIATE BENEFIT TO JOHNSON UNIVERSITY IS THE POTENTIAL OF AN ESTATE PLANNING EXPECTANCY THAT MOST LIKELY WILL NOT BE REALIZED FOR YEARS TO COME.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Sch G
Schedule G, Part I, Line 2b(iv)

The College expects contributions to be generated by these endeavors in future years.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule G, Part I, Line 2a Fundraising Agreement
ExplntnTxt: THE ACCEPTED PROPOSAL FOR FUNDRAISING ACTIVITIES PROVIDES THAT THE COLLEGE IS INVOICED ON A WEEKLY BASIS, AND THAT ALL INVOICES REFLECT THE NUMBER OF DIRECT MAIL PIECES SENT. THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES THAT THE FEES FOR SET-UP, PRINTING AND PROCUREMENT OF STATIONERY AND FORMS APPEAR IN THE FIRST INVOICE. THE SET UP FEES ARE A FIXED AMOUNT. CHARGES FOR TELEPHONE CALLING, TRAINING, AND GENERAL SERVICES ARE PRICED AT AN HOURLY RATE AND DIRECT MAIL CHARGES ARE PRICED AT A PER ITEM BASIS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2B, COLUMN (V)
ExplntnTxt: ADVANCEMENT SERVICES (ROYALL) WAS HIRED IN 2013 TO HELP ADVANCE OUR ANNUAL GIVING FUNDRAISING. THE EMPHASIS OF THE INITIATIVE WAS TO INCREASE ALUMNI PARTICIPATION THROUGH ACQUISITION OF NEW ALUMNI DONORS. THE COMPANY CREATED AND MANAGED OUR CALENDAR YEAR END AND FISCAL YEAR END SOLICITATIONS FOR 2013. THEY MADE A MAJOR ERROR BY SOLICITING A NUMBER OF OUR PRESIDENT'S COUNCIL DONORS THROUGH THE CALENDAR YEAR END SOLICITATION. THEIR EFFORTS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF NEW ALUMNI DONORS TO RMU FELL SHORT. WE TERMINATED THEIR INVOLVEMENT AT THE END OF FISCAL YEAR 2013/14 AND MADE OUR FINAL PAYMENT FOR SERVICES RENDERED IN JUNE 2014. WE DID GAIN VALUABLE ANALYSIS AND INFORMATION PERTAINING TO CONSECUTIVE GIVING BY ALUMNI, FIRST TIME DONOR RECOGNITION, RENEWAL RATES FROM CONSECUTIVE DONORS AND APPROPRIATE ALUMNI SEGMENTS TO TARGET. WE HAVE BEEN ABLE TO UTILIZE THIS INFORMATION IN OUR CURRENT ANNUAL FUNDRAISING STRATEGIES FOR FISCAL YEAR 2014/15.

It is difficult to quantify the receipts from such activity so none are being reported for this fiscal year.
